member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_SIDE_CHANNEL_ISOLATION_POLICY
member.summary: This data structure provides the status of process policies that are related to the mitigation of side channels. This can include side channel attacks involving speculative execution and page combining.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_SIDE_CHANNEL_ISOLATION_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.Flags
member.summary: This member is reserved for system use.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_SIDE_CHANNEL_ISOLATION_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.SmtBranchTargetIsolation
member.summary: Prevent branch target pollution cross-SMT-thread in user mode.

summary.para: Isolate this process into a distinct security domain, even from other processes running as the same security context. This prevents branch target injection cross-process.

Page combining is limited to processes within the same security domain. This flag effectively limits the process to only combining internally to the process itself, except for common pages and unless further restricted by theDisablePageCombine policy.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_SIDE_CHANNEL_ISOLATION_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.DisablePageCombine
member.summary: Disable all page combining for this process, even internally to the process itself, except for common pages.

member.name: PROCESS_MITIGATION_SIDE_CHANNEL_ISOLATION_POLICY.DUMMYUNIONNAME.DUMMYSTRUCTNAME.ReservedFlags
member.summary: This member is reserved for system use.
